contact_name: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union
description: The deflated house price index (or real house price index) is the ratio between the house price index (HPI) and the national accounts deflator for private final consumption expenditure (households and non-profit institutions serving households (NPISHs) ). This indicator therefore measures inflation in the house market relative to inflation in the final consumption expenditure of households and NPISHs. Eurostat HPI captures price changes of all residential properties purchased by households (flats, detached houses, terraced houses, etc.), both new and existing, independently of their final use and their previous owners. Only market prices are considered, self-build dwellings are therefore excluded. The land component is included. The data are expressed as annual index 2010=100 and as 1 year % change. The MIP scoreboard indicator is the year-on-year growth rate of the deflated house price index, with an indicative threshold of 6%. The scoreboard indicator is calculated using the formula: [((HPIt/DEFLt)–(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1))/(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1)]*100.
title: House price index, deflated - annual data
name: GBc7FXcPtanFPKHm1LKhzQ
contact_address: Joseph Bech building, 5 Rue Alphonse Weicker, L-2721 Luxembourg
rdf:
<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:ecodp="http://open-data.europa.eu/ontologies/ec-odp#" xmlns:foaf="http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/" xmlns:dct="http://purl.org/dc/terms/" xmlns:skos="http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#" xmlns:dcat="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#">
  <dcat:Dataset rdf:about="http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/products-datasets/-/tipsho10">
    <dct:title xml:lang="en">House price index, deflated - annual data</dct:title>
    <dct:title xml:lang="fr">Indice des prix des logements, déflaté - données annuelles</dct:title>
    <dct:title xml:lang="de">Hauspreisindex, bereinigt - jährliche Daten</dct:title>
    <dct:identifier>tipsho10</dct:identifier>
    <dct:description xml:lang="en">The deflated house price index (or real house price index) is the ratio between the house price index (HPI) and the national accounts deflator for private final consumption expenditure (households and non-profit institutions serving households (NPISHs) ). This indicator therefore measures inflation in the house market relative to inflation in the final consumption expenditure of households and NPISHs. Eurostat HPI captures price changes of all residential properties purchased by households (flats, detached houses, terraced houses, etc.), both new and existing, independently of their final use and their previous owners. Only market prices are considered, self-build dwellings are therefore excluded. The land component is included. The data are expressed as annual index 2010=100 and as 1 year % change. The MIP scoreboard indicator is the year-on-year growth rate of the deflated house price index, with an indicative threshold of 6%. The scoreboard indicator is calculated using the formula: [((HPIt/DEFLt)–(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1))/(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1)]*100.</dct:description>
    <dct:description xml:lang="fr">L'indice déflaté des prix des logements (ou prix réels des logements) est le ratio entre l'indice des prix des logements (IPL) et le déflateur des dépenses de consommation finale privée [ménages et institutions sans but lucratif au service des ménages (ISBL)]. Par conséquent, cet indicateur mesure l'inflation sur le marché des logements comparée à celle de la consommation finale des ménages et des ISBL. Les données sont exprimées sous forme d'indice annuel 2010=100 et de variation en pourcentage sur un an. L'indicateur du tableau de bord est la variation en pourcentage sur un an de l'indice déflaté des prix des logements, avec un seuil indicatif de 6 %. L'indicateur du tableau de bord est calculé selon la formule suivante: [((IPLt/DEFLt)–(IPLt-1/DEFLt-1))/(IPLt-1/DEFLt-1)]*100.</dct:description>
    <dct:description xml:lang="de">Der bereinigte Hauspreisindex (oder Wohnimmobilienindex zu realen Preisen) ist das Verhältnis zwischen dem Hauspreisindex und dem Deflator der Volkswirtschaftlichen Gesamtrechnungen für die privaten Konsumausgaben nach dem Verbrauchskonzept (private Haushalte und private Organisationen ohne Erwerbszweck). Dieser Indikator misst somit die Inflation am Markt für Wohnimmobilien im Verhältnis zur Inflation der Konsumausgaben der privaten Haushalte und privaten Organisationen ohne Erwerbszweck. Die Angaben werden als jährlicher Index (2010 = 100) und als Veränderung in % gegenüber dem Vorjahr dargestellt. Der Indikator des VMU-Anzeigers (VMU – Verfahren bei einem makroökonomischen Ungleichgewicht) misst die prozentuale Veränderung des bereinigten Hauspreisindex über ein Jahr, wobei der indikative Schwellenwert 6 % beträgt. Dieser Indikator wird nach folgender Formel berechnet: [((HPIt/DEFLt)–(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1))/(HPIt-1/DEFLt-1)]*100.</dct:description>
